top_categories.workout_context: Rasputitsa Spring Classic’s vermont mountains, spring mud season demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Rasputitsa Spring Classic isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Rasputitsa Spring Classic rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Rasputitsa Spring Classic when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Rasputitsa Spring Classic’s vermont mountainous gravel with spring mud drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Rasputitsa Spring Classic — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Rasputitsa Spring Classic. Make this intensity feel like home.
Rasputitsa Spring Classic’s 5,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Rasputitsa Spring Classic’s vermont mountainous gravel with spring mud and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Rasputitsa Spring Classic — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on vermont mountainous gravel with spring mud.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Rasputitsa Spring Classic count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Rasputitsa Spring Classic’s 5,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Rasputitsa Spring Classic’s 60 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Rasputitsa Spring Classic demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride vermont mountainous gravel with spring mud at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: vermont mountains, spring mud season, mountainous gravel. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 60 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 60 miles of vermont mountainous gravel with spring mud in Burke, Vermont.
